metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7049 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.3 isaffected. Safari before 10.1.2 is affected. iCloud before 6.2.2 on Windowsis affected. iTunes before 12.6.2 on Windows is affected. tvOS before10.2.2 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
webkitgtk package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-source package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
